originalText.text:
Very highly recommend hiring handymen from A2Z! I recently moved into the area and Felipe in particular helped me set up my table and gaming chair for my pc setup and was very friendly and sociable. Regarding the store I also highly recommend visiting there, they have everything you need, power strips, adapters, etc.
All in all great shop with great, friendly staff! Services were also very affordable and reasonable. 10/10. Highly recommend.

text.text:

originalText.text: I recently had the pleasure of working with the local A2Z Hardware store for the installation of curtain rods in my home. Ahmed and Felipe were incredibly easy and helpful to work with. From the moment I called, Ahmed took the time to listen to my needs and provide expert advice on the best products for my project. The installation process was seamless and completed quickly. I am extremely satisfied with the end result and would highly recommend A2Z Hardware to anyone in need of handy or installation services. Their customer service is top-notch, and the quality of their work is outstanding. Overall, a fantastic experience.

originalText.text: I would recommend hiring handymen from A2Z! I’ve hired them twice and both times I called to schedule only a day prior. Both Felipe and Ahmed did great installing my window AC unit, a TV bracket on my wall and a sliding trash can holder for my kitchen cabinet. Very reasonable prices!

text.text: I would recommend hiring handymen from A2Z! I’ve hired them twice and both times I called to schedule only a day prior. Both Felipe and Ahmed did great installing my window AC unit, a TV bracket on my wall and a sliding trash can holder for my kitchen cabinet. Very reasonable prices!

originalText.text: I have lived in this neighborhood for 12 years. This store has had various owners/ management the current staff is the worst. I paid $150 for a “ plumber/ handyman” to change my faucet in my kitchen. He was hired to arrive at 4pm he arrived at 6 pm. He was able to change the faucet in less than 30 minutes. He then requested $15 dollars for extra wires he had to use - I was a bit irritated with this new charge since he was 2 hours late - He then began to raise his voice at me  in my home  and stated this job would cost me more than $150 if I used some one else - I told him fine I will pay the $15 I just wanted this horrible experience over. By this time I was late for another appointment he was gathering his tools so I asked him to please close the door behind  it’s a slam lock. I came back to my apt 3 hours later and my door was left open. This was malicious and done on purpose.( Image below of how I found my apt door when I arrived home.) I reported this to the  manager Ahmed. He claimed “there must have been a misunderstanding “ This neighborhood has multiple hardware stores one on 145 street bet 7&8 + 145  street and Broadway - Home Depot across the bridge 145 street.  Choose wisely folks.

originalText.text: One of the best hardware stores in Harlem. They also provide handyman services if needed. They assisted with putting up a pot rack in my apartment and did an excellent job!
